DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine whether behavioral strategy implement adoption versus maintenance period weight loss enhance exercise participation overweight adult effective standard behavioral intervention .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Female Male 2 . 1855 year age 3 . BMI = 2539.9 kg/m2 4 . Ability provide inform consent . 5 . Ability provide consent personal physician participate study . 1 . Reporting regular exercise participation least 20 minute per day least 3 day per week previous six month . ( This study design recruit relatively sedentary adult . ) 2 . Diabetes , hypothyroidism , medical condition would affect energy metabolism . 3 . Women currently pregnant , pregnant within previous six month , plan become pregnant within next 18 month . ( Pregnancy initial screening base selfreport include detailed medical history complete subject ) 4 . Nonmedicated rest systolic blood pressure > 160 mmHg nonmedicated rest diastolic blood pressure > 100 mmHg , take medication would affect blood pressure . 5 . Taking medication would affect rest heart rate heart rate response exercise ( e.g. , beta blockade ) . 6 . Arrhythmia rest exercise electrocardiogram would indicate vigorous exercise contraindicate . 7 . History myocardial infarction valvular disease . 8 . Weight loss > 5 % body weight within previous 12 month . 9 . History orthopedic complication would prevent optimal participation exercise component ( e.g. , heel spur , severe arthritis ) .
